CatDescriptText: Florence Robinson, Whitsett, Pa., near Perryopolis, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1958, pg. 1 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "I"m a San Francisco Giant fan.  However, as for the Pirates, I think that they have made quite an improvement.  There are a lot of wasted players on the bench.  They could use the colored player on first base.  And there is Powers and also some other guys who deserve a bigger break than they are getting now."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Florence Robinson wearing dark plaid suit jacket, light colored blouse with sheer ribbed neckline and collar, holding rectangular patterned pillow and handbag, standing in front of window displaying potted plants, curtain, and Duquesne Pilsner Beer and Public Telephone signs
